issue_summary: Negative amount in generated payment plan after modification of reservation
issue_description:
ImpactA negative amount appears in the generated payment plan after modifying a reservation. This issue affects users by potentially leading to incorrect billing or confusion regarding payment amounts.EnvironmentThe bug is present in the environment associated with site ID: 12624.BookingID: 41759360ELK link for further investigation: ELK Linksuite link  Expected behaviourThe payment plan should reflect accurate amounts based on the modifications made to the reservation. No negative amounts should be generated.Actual behaviourThe system currently generates a payment plan with a negative amount after a reservation is modified.Steps to reproduceBook a stay (pay , not pay doesn‚Äôt matter)Modify an existing reservation to a lower price from the guest panel (not Suite)Observe the payment plan for any negative amounts in Suite.https://suite.profitroom.dev/pl/8804/reception/reservations/details/be-31718474?room-id=be-33411675- produkcja 8803 - 42034012https://elk.profitroom.net/s/microservices/app/discover#/?_g=(filters:!(),refreshInterval:(pause:!t,value:0),time:(from:now-2d,to:now))&_a=(columns:!(%23name,%23payload),dataSource:(dataViewId:'5b9c1dcf-7538-50d1-928d-66f7d45ee4d2',type:dataView),filters:!(),grid:(columns:(%23name:(width:372),%23timestamp:(width:148))),interval:auto,query:(language:kuery,query:'42034012'),sort:!(!(%23timestamp,desc)))FROM CALUDEOriginal reservation: price 1000, deposit/prepayment madeGuest modifies to price 500  According to the recent fix (commit b455ddfa4), the logic at lines 305-330 will execute if either:Deposit > 0 ORDepositPaid > 0  Let's trace the calculation:Line 307: $deposit = (float) $reservation->DepositPaid ?: (float) $reservation->DepositIf the original booking had a deposit of 1000 paid, DepositPaid = 1000Line 321: $remainingAmount = (float) PriceCalculator::subtract($reservation->GrossPriceTotal,
$deposit)New GrossPriceTotal = 500$remainingAmount = 500 - 1000 = -500Line 323-327: Since $remainingAmount is non-zero (it's -500), it adds a second installment with -500‚è∫ Root Cause Identified!  The problem is in the payment plan calculation logic at lines 305-330 in JsonFactory.php. When a
  reservation price is reduced but the DepositPaid remains from the original higher price:Line 307: Uses DepositPaid (1000 from original booking)Line 321: Calculates remainingAmount = GrossPriceTotal (500) - DepositPaid (1000) = -500Line 323-327: Adds the negative amount as a second installment because it's non-zero  The issue is that the code doesn't handle the case where DepositPaid exceeds the new GrossPriceTotal.
  It blindly subtracts and creates a negative installment.  The Bug  The logic assumes that DepositPaid will always be less than or equal to GrossPriceTotal, but when a
  guest modifies their reservation to a lower price, this assumption breaks. The system should:Recognize when DepositPaid > GrossPriceTotal (overpayment situation)Either:
- Not create a second installment for negative amounts
- Handle refunds differently
- Recalculate the deposit based on the new total  This explains your example perfectly:Original: 1000 total, 1000 deposit paidModified: 500 total, but system still has 1000 as DepositPaidResult: [{"date":"2025-09-02","dueAmount":"1000"},{"date":"2025-10-08","dueAmount":"-500"}]propable cause
